meta.description: Latest news on GMO food, GMO crops, GMO labelling and genetically modified organisms

title: GMWatch Home
cleaned_text:
Disgraced MP at centre of UK’s lobbying scandal was close ally of GMO lobby Owen Paterson’s former bedfellows take cover as he quits the House of Commons. Report: Jonathan Matthews

The (GM) soy curse: Is Ukraine facing the same fate as the Amazon? The EU wants to crank up soy production in eastern Europe. But with illegal genetically modified crops rife, who will benefit?

Brazil clears GMO wheat flour from Argentina, but sales may be slow Shipments of the new variety developed in Argentina are unlikely anytime soon due to opposition from Brazilian millers and global consumers

Please support protesters in Argentina against the GMO onslaught Argentina’s rural communities are being devastated by the GMO/toxic model of agriculture, writes Jonathan Matthews

Scientists find yet more genetic errors from CRISPR gene editing Large structural changes were detected at on-target and off-target sites of the genome; researchers call for better screening for unintended effects

Leading ag journalist hails plant breeding breakthrough, saying it "flies in the face" of Monsanto. Report: Jonathan Matthews and Claire Robinson

New resources to share on why gene editing must not be deregulated and won't solve climate change Take quick and easy action – your food future depends on it!

Why do GMOs for developing countries always disappoint? New analysis shows why hyped-up forecasts of a GMO’s potential don’t match the reality in the field – and suggests that new GM crops for Africa will also fail. Report: Claire Robinson

Glyphosate: 41 groups tell EU Commission to end use of unreliable industry studies Only two out of 38 glyphosate genotoxicity studies submitted by industry were found reliable

National Council must report on coexistence and liability in the event of GMO contamination within four years
